function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Recycled air in ventilation and air conditioning systems can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission and outbreaks within buildings and transportation systems.","Mitigation":"Operate ventilation and air conditioning systems on full outdoor air mode to reduce the recycling of air.","Technologies":"Advanced air filtration systems and UV air disinfection technologies can lower the risk of disease transmission through ventilation systems.","People":"Building occupants, commuters, and public transportation users.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, HVAC technicians"},{"Description":"Inadequate airflow and ventilation in indoor spaces can lead to poor air quality and increased risk of disease transmission.","Impact":"Higher likelihood of airborne disease transmission and occupant discomfort due to poor air circulation.","Mitigation":"Position air outlets to ensure good airflow without directly blowing air into occupied areas, and consider the cooling capacity of the unit to ensure proper airflow.","Technologies":"Natural ventilation systems, advanced HVAC airflow control technologies.","People":"Building occupants, facility managers, HVAC technicians.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, HVAC technicians"},{"Description":"Inaccurate control of airflow and airspeed can lead to the transport of virus-carrying particles within indoor spaces.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission from one part of the room to another due to improper airflow and airspeed control.","Mitigation":"Regular distribution of temperatures, control of the rate of airflow and airspeed, and use of natural ventilation to reduce the risk of infectious aerosols.","Technologies":"Advanced HVAC airflow control technologies, natural ventilation systems.","People":"Building occupants, facility managers, HVAC technicians.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, HVAC technicians"}]}
